Package de.gnwi.mfsim.gui.chart

Class XyChartDataManipulator

java.lang.Object
de.gnwi.mfsim.gui.chart.XyChartDataManipulator
public class XyChartDataManipulator extends Object
Manipulator for xy-data
Author:
Jan-Mathis Hein, Achim Zielesny (safeguard additions)

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    add(double aX, double aY)
    Adds a xy-pair to the original data NOTE: After adding a new number the XyChartDataManipulator is not updated
    double[]
    getChartRange()
    Returns the range of the updated data plus some offsets {xMin, xMax, yMin, yMax}
    int
    getNumberOfDiscardedInitialPoints()
    Returns the number of discarded initial points
    int
    getNumberOfPointsInUpdatedData()
    Returns the number of points in the updated data
    double[]
    getStatistics()
    Returns the statistics for the updated data {tmpYmin, tmpSampleMean, tmpSampleMeanError, tmpYmax, tmpSampleStandardDeviation, tmpLinearRegressionSlope}
    double[]
    getStatistics(int anIndex)
    Returns the statistics for the updated data but only consider data up to a certain point (point is included) or returns null if there is not enough data.
    org.jfree.data.xy.XYSeries
    getTrend()
    Returns the trend line for the updated data in the form of a start and end point
    org.jfree.data.xy.XYSeries
    getTrend(int anIndex)
    Returns the trend line for the updated data but only consider data up to a certain point (point is included) or returns null if there is not enough data.
    double[]
    getUpdatedDataBoundaires()
    Returns the updated data boundaries
    org.jfree.data.xy.XYSeries
    getUpdatedXySeries(int aNumberToAverage)
    Returns the updated data as a XYSeries with averaged y-values
    double[]
    getZoomValues()
    Returns the zoom values {xMin, xMax, yMin, yMax}
    void
    incrementNumberOfDiscardedInitialPoints()
    Increases the number of points to be initially discarded for the updated data by one and calls update()
    void
    reset()
    Resets the zoom values and number of initially discarded points and calls update()
    void
    setNumberOfDiscardedInitialPoints(int aNumberOfInitialDiscardedPoints)
    Sets the number of initial discarded points for the updated data and calls update()
    void
    setZoomValues(double[] aZoomValues)
    Sets the zoom values for the updated data, updates updatedDataBoundaries and calls update()
    void
    update()
    Updates updatedXyPairs and updatedDataBoundaries if allowed
    void
    updateXyPairsArray()
    Updates this.updatedXyPairsArray with the data from this.updatedXyPairsList

    • getStatistics

      public double[] getStatistics(int anIndex)
      Returns the statistics for the updated data but only consider data up to a certain point (point is included) or returns null if there is not enough data. {tmpYmin, tmpSampleMean, tmpSampleMeanError, tmpYmax, tmpSampleStandardDeviation, tmpLinearRegressionSlope}
      Parameters:
      anIndex - A point up to which data is considered (point is included)
      Returns:
      The statistics for the updated data but only consider data up to a certain point (point is included) or return null if there is not enough data. {tmpYmin, tmpSampleMean, tmpSampleMeanError, tmpYmax, tmpSampleStandardDeviation, tmpLinearRegressionSlope}

    • getTrend

      public org.jfree.data.xy.XYSeries getTrend()

      Returns:
      The trend line for the updated data in the form of a start and end point

    • getTrend

      public org.jfree.data.xy.XYSeries getTrend(int anIndex)
      Returns the trend line for the updated data but only consider data up to a certain point (point is included) or returns null if there is not enough data. The trend line is represented by a start and end point
      Parameters:
      anIndex - A point up to which data is considered (point is included)
      Returns:
      The trend line for the updated data but only consider data up to a certain point (point is included) or return null if there is not enough data. The trend line is represented by a start and end point

      Returns the updated data as a XYSeries with averaged y-values
      Parameters:
      aNumberToAverage - Number of y-values to average
      Returns:
      The updated data as a XYSeries with averaged y-values

    • add

      public void add(double aX, double aY)
      Adds a xy-pair to the original data NOTE: After adding a new number the XyChartDataManipulator is not updated
      Parameters:
      aX - A x value to add
      aY - A y value to add
